intro: Vahlia somalensis subsp. goddingii, commonly known as the Somali vahlia, is a flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It has limited distribution and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and potential medicinal properties.
